clueServer
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  clueServer.Server

public class Server
extends Object

Class semantics and roles:
The Server class represents the top of the server-side class hierarchy. This is essentially the driver for the server-side software. The roles include directing the actions of all other server-side classes and starting / ending the server-side program session(s).

Information Maintenance:
Creation: The Server object, and there is only one, is created when the server-side program is launched
Deletion: the Server object is not destroyed until the server-side program is shut down

Author:
Michael Philippone (Class Skeletons and Code), Todd Wright (Code)

 void play()
          Purpose: Start game play on and alert all classes lower on the class-hierarchy of game play

Precondition: All classes necessary for game-play have been loaded and initialized
Postcondition: The game has begun
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- WHILE the game is not over (a player has not won, all have not lost OR all players are not removed):
- - IF current player designated to take a turn is removed from play: - - - call Server.computerPlayer()
- - - continue loop
- - listen on the socket for the current player
- - call corresponding method based on the result of the socket communication
- - - move
- - - - call GameLogic.move() method
- - - - get logic.board.display property (this is the String[][] representation of the board)
- - - - communicate that to Client on Player object who has active designation (a not true Player.isComputerPlayer() return value)
- - - - read the message from Client regarding selected position (X,Y coord)
- - - - call logic.board.piece.relocate(X,Y) to move player
- - - - call logic.board.serialize()
- - - - get logic.board.display property (this is the String[][] representation of the board)
- - - - communicate board model from above step to ALL Players
- - - - read from client for next step (accuse, guess, endturn)
- - - guess
- - - - call logic.guess() method.

prePlay

public void prePlay()
Purpose: Begin executing actions that are necessary to begin game-play.

Precondition: The All players are created and connected
Postcondition: All server-side program components have been initialized and game play can begin
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- get a serialized, String version of the board with ALL spaces marked for update
- call Player's update method with String board version
- give players their cards
- ANYTHING ELSE??? END

LAST MODIFIED: Michael Philippone, 12 DEC 2008

play

public void play()
Purpose: Start game play on and alert all classes lower on the class-hierarchy of game play

Precondition: All classes necessary for game-play have been loaded and initialized
Postcondition: The game has begun
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- WHILE the game is not over (a player has not won, all have not lost OR all players are not removed):
- - IF current player designated to take a turn is removed from play: - - - call Server.computerPlayer()
- - - continue loop
- - listen on the socket for the current player
- - call corresponding method based on the result of the socket communication
- - - move
- - - - call GameLogic.move() method
- - - - get logic.board.display property (this is the String[][] representation of the board)
- - - - communicate that to Client on Player object who has active designation (a not true Player.isComputerPlayer() return value)
- - - - read the message from Client regarding selected position (X,Y coord)
- - - - call logic.board.piece.relocate(X,Y) to move player
- - - - call logic.board.serialize()
- - - - get logic.board.display property (this is the String[][] representation of the board)
- - - - communicate board model from above step to ALL Players
- - - - read from client for next step (accuse, guess, endturn)
- - - guess
- - - - call logic.guess() method. pass in CHARACTER, WEAPON, ROOM
- - - - test returned string from logic.guess() (previous step) for error
- - - - IF no error:
- - - - - IF returns true:
- - - - - - send message to all players that guess was made, what it was and that it was NOT disproved
- - - - - ELSE (guess returns false meaning that it can be disproved):
- - - - - - IF one of the returned player numbers is a 6 or an 8:
- - - - - - - that card is one of the mystery cards or there was an invalid card guess (respectively) and it should be ignored
- - - - - - ensure that each specified player returned from guess method is distinct
- - - - - - notify the players specified (in the order they connected to the game after the current player--looping back to Miss Scarlet if need be) that they need to choose one (or more) of the applicable cards to show so long as they are NOT the player whose turn it is (TO BE REPLACED by the Server.notifyCardChoice() method
- - - - - - display the chosen card to all players with message that guess was disproved
- - - - - - update all Player's board - - - - ELSE (error): - - - - - treat an error as a wrong guess but with no cards shown
- - - accuse
- - - - call GameLogic.accuse() method
- - - - - - - exit
- - - - remove player from game play
- - - - add player to computer player
END

LAST MODIFIED: Michael Philippone, 12 DEC 2008

systemShutdown

public void systemShutdown(Utilities.e_ExitCode status)
Purpose: Shut down the server program. This is a convenience method for de-allocating the Server-Side components

Precondition: The game has been won by someone or lost by all
Postcondition: There are no longer instantiated server components.
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- use the System method exit(int) to close this program
- flag the Operating System with this method's parameter value
END

LAST MODIFIED: Michael Philippone, 12 DEC 2008

Parameters:
status - the Utilities.e_ExitCode status flag to return to the operating system as an integer

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Purpose: This is the main method that is run for the server-side software. It all starts here!

Precondition: The system is NOT running.
Postcondition: The system has started running and the server-side objects are instantiated
Pseudo-Code :
BEGIN
- create and instance of a Server object
- run createServerComponents() method
- run prePlay() method
- run play() method
- run systemShutdown() method
END

Parameters:
args - - any command line options passed in

prepOutput

private void prepOutput()
Purpose: Utility method for prepping output streams and determining debug modes
Explanation:
Here seems as good a place as any to explain a bit about the File output that appears throughout the server software.

1) There is a flag in the Server class (Server.debugMode) that, when true allows special, added output to occurr. The output consists of messages regarding the server program's state, network connections, method alerts, non-fatal error conditions and debugging information. (And anything else that we MIGHT want to communicate to an admin user.

2) Anywhere in the Server program that non-necessary output could occurr, the debugMode flag is tested for true and the output is printed accordingly. (For all necessary outputs, a duplicate message is printed to the chosen debugging output stream: Server.out. see #3 for more info on the output stream(s))

3) Throughout the software, there are calls to System.out methods. (ie: System.out.print(); and System.out.println(); ) those have been modified to use the Server class' output stream "out" instead of the System's output stream (with the same name, for conceptual ease of use).


Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- IF debugging mode is on:
- - Assign the Server's console output stream to a file (or leave it set to console if there is a failure)
- - return
END
